“Friendly Fire” »

“Rescind, Resign, or Recall”

February 17th, 2007

Source: The Valley Chronicle 2/17/07 / Board Under Fire:

“Those are three choices MSJC Faculty Senate President said he plans to present to the college Board of Trustees at its March 8 meeting.”

According to information presented by Academic Senate President, Sterling Roulette to open forums held at both the Menifee Valley campus and the San Jacinto campus, the MSJC Board of Trustees’, three member majority, Eugene Kadow, Joan Sparkman, and Gwendolyn Schlange, decision to fire college President and CEO Mark Zacovic has angered members of the faculty, staff and student body and should not be allowed to stand unchallenged.

ASB President, Maria Boer spoke stating concern that “this board decision will make it difficult or impossible to find a quality replacement.”

Trustee’s McGargill and Motte have suggested that the decision to fire Zacovic was made in haste and with some attempt at deception. Motte was out of state at the time the decision was made. McGargill stated discussion in the closed session during which the vote was taken was minimal and said she still does not understand the cause for Zacovic’s dismissal. She also objected to the board’s failure to give him an opportunity to make corrections if there were problems with his performance.

Motte said the vote violated a verbal agreement she had with the board to hold off any discussion and action until she returned from out of state. “They violated my trust”.

Sterling Roulette, Academic Senate President, Quote: “This was done without cause,” he said. “We have assassinated a visionary.”

One student stated he is prepared to help launch a recall effort.
